titleInfo.title: Letter No. 318 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to His Excellency Colonel Justin Sheil, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia

mods.abstract: The letter relates to incidents of slave trading on the Persian coast. It contains a report of two vessels owned by inhabitants of Bushire which have been reported carrying male and female slaves. Of the first incident, Samuel Hennell reports that the boat owner maintained his innocence, and the offence of slave trading was not proven. In the second case, the boat owner was arrested by the Acting Govenor of Bushire (Sheikh Abdoollah), and a fine proposed.
